cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text: Target wall can now attack. Target wall's power and toughness are unchanged, even if its power is 0.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: All lands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Whichever player has more lands in play must discard enough lands of his or her choice to equalize the number of lands both players have in play. Cards in hand and creatures in play must be equalized the same way. Creatures lost in this manner may not be regenerated.

cards.name: Blaze of Glory
cards.text: Target defending creature can and must block all attacking creatures it can legally block. For example, a normal non-flying target defender can and must block all normal non-flying attackers at once, but it cannot block any flying attackers. Controller of target defender may distribute damage among attackers as desired. Play before defense is chosen.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: o1: Prevents all damage against you from one red source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: o1: Prevents all damage against you from one white source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to white. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Red Ward

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Take a creature from your graveyard and put it directly into play. You can't tap it until your next turn.

cards.name: Reverse Damage

cards.text: Counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.

cards.name: Braingeyser
cards.text: Draw X cards or force opponent to draw X cards.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: Upon summoning, Clone acquires all normal characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on original creature are not copied. Clone retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. Clone cannot be played if there are no creatures in play.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. You can't tap target creature this turn, but if it was already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Copy Artifact
cards.text:
Select any artifact in play. This enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts.
Enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counters target spell as it is being cast.

cards.name: Creature Bond
cards.text: If target creature is destroyed, Creature Bond does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Tap all opponent's lands, taking all this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool into your mana pool. You can't tap fewer than all opponent's lands.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during each upkeep.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text: Target creature is now a flying creature.

cards.name: Invisibility
cards.text: Target creature can be blocked only by walls.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature is a flying creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Lifetap

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text: Tap to do 1 damage to any target. Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still tap. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana each turn during upkeep. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana; caster of target spell can't choose to let it be countered. If caster of target spell doesn't have enough mana, all available mana from lands and mana pool must be paid but target spell will still be countered.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play.
Serpent is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Siren's Call
cards.text: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are destroyed at end of turn. Play only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Cannot change mana symbols.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Target spell is countered; X is cost of target spell.

cards.text:
Players do not get an untap phase. Pay o

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Thoughtlace
cards.text: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to blue. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Time Walk
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Timetwister
cards.text: Set Timetwister aside in a new graveyard pile. Shuffle your hand, library, and graveyard together into a new library and draw a new hand of seven cards, leaving all cards in play where they are; opponent must do the same.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: Caster may tap or untap any one land, creature, or artifact in play.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return creature to owner's hand; enchantments on creature are CARD ed. Unsummon cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

cards.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
cards.text: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all normal characteristics (except color) of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppelganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

cards.name: Natural Selection
cards.text: Look at top three cards of any player's library. You may opt to rearrange those three cards or shuffle the entire library.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
oo
G Target creature regenerates.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return any card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.

cards.name: Timber Wolves
cards.text: Bands

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: All islands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
oo
G Regenerates

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during upkeep.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample

cards.name: Web
cards.text: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain the power to fly.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text: When tapped, target land provides 1 green mana in addition to the mana it normally provides.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase, but can be untapped at any time for 3 mana. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Lotus
cards.text: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during upkeep, black vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

cards.name: Celestial Prism
cards.text: o2: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Chaos Orb
cards.text: o1: Flip Chaos Orb onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Chaos Orb must turn completely over at least once or it is discarded with no effect. When Chaos Orb lands, any cards in play that it touches are destroyed, as is Chaos Orb.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the untap phase, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 mana per counter instead of untapping Beast; this taps Beast if it wasn't tapped already.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: o3: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

cards.name: Copper Tablet
cards.text: Copper Tablet does 1 damage to each player during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: o1: Any blue spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Cyclopean Tomb
cards.text: o2: Turn any one non-swamp land into swamp during upkeep. Mark the changed lands with tokens. If Cyclopean Tomb is destroyed, remove one token of your choice each upkeep, returning that land to its original nature.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever anyone loses a land, Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: o3: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during your turn.

cards.name: Forcefield
cards.text: o1: Lose only 1 life to an unblocked creature.

cards.name: Gauntlet of Might
cards.text: All red creatures gain +1/+1 and all mountains provide an extra red mana when tapped.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: You may look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: o1: You may give one creature the ability to band until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: Each player draws one extra card each turn during his or her draw phase.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: o1: You may tap any land, creature, or artifact in play on either side.

cards.name: Illusionary Mask
cards.text:
oo
X You can summon a creature face down so opponent doesn't know what it is. The X cost can be any amount of mana, even 0; it serves to hide the true casting cost of the creature, which you still have to spend. As soon as a face-down creature receives damage, deals damage, or is tapped, you must turn it face up.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: o1: Any red spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: o1: Any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: o1: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

cards.name: Jade Statue
cards.text: o2: Jade Statue becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. Can be a creature only during an attack or defense.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: o4: You may draw one extra card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. Swamps have no color; they are not considered black cards.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text: There is no limit to size of your hand. If a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. If discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text: Counts as a wall. o1: Regenerates.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Mana Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must pay 4 mana. If Mana Vault remains tapped during upkeep it does 1 damage to you. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Any creature with power greater than 2 may not be untapped as normal during the untap phase.

cards.name: Mox Emerald
cards.text: Add 1 green mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Mox Jet
cards.text: Add 1 black mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Mox Pearl
cards.text: Add 1 white mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Mox Ruby
cards.text: Add 1 red mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Mox Sapphire
cards.text: Add 1 blue mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text: o1: Destroys all creatures, enchantments, and artifacts in play. Disk begins tapped but can be untapped as usual. Disk destroys itself when used.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: o3: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: o1: You gain 1 life every time a creature is destroyed, unless it is then regenerated.

cards.name: Sunglasses of Urza
cards.text: White mana in your mana pool can be used as either white or red mana.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: o5: Creates one Giant Wasp, a 1/1 flying creature. Represent Wasps with tokens, making sure to indicate when each Wasp is tapped. Wasps can't attack during the turn created. Treat Wasps like artifact creatures in every way, except that they are removed from the game entirely if they ever leave play. If the Hive is destroyed, the Wasps must still be killed individually.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: o1: Any black spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Time Vault
cards.text: Tap to gain an additional turn after the current one. Time Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must skip a turn. Time Vault begins tapped.

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: Players can untap only one land each during untap phase. Creatures and artifacts are untapped as normal.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: o1: Any green spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.
